definition: bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to push aside with the hand, foot, a stick etc/to dial/to allocate/to set aside (money)/to poke (the fire)/to pluck (a string instrument)/to turn round/classifier: group, batch
in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
first month of the lunar year
straight/upright/proper/main/principal/to correct/to rectify/exactly/just (at that time)/right (in that place)/(math.) positive

sentences.english: The question of intellectuals bring order out of chaos, the role of major and far-reaching impact.
sentences.chinese: 知识分子题目拨乱反正，作用重大，影响深远。

sentences.english: Now slowly we are putting it back together.
sentences.chinese: 英嘉说，“现在我们慢慢地拨乱反正。”

definition: to discard the old and introduce the new (idiom); to innovate
many things waiting to be done (idiom)/a thousand things to do
to correct/to amend/to redress (evils)
to recover one's power or authority/restoration (of a past regime)
all neglected tasks are being undertaken (idiom)/work is now underway
Rectification or Rectifying incorrect work styles, Maoist slogan/cf Rectification campaign 整風運動|整风运动, army purge of 1942-44 and anti-rightist purge of 1957
Rectification campaign/political purge/cf Mao's 1942-44 campaign at Yanan, and his 1950 and 1957 anti-rightist purges
laws and discipline of imperial court
to destroy the old and establish the new (idiom)/radical transformation
to go against the tide (idiom); to do things all wrong/to try to turn back history/a perverse way of doing things
lit. drain away filth and bring in fresh water (idiom); fig. dispel evil and usher in good/eliminate vice and exalt virtue
age-old (malpractice)/long established (corrupt practices)/deeply rooted (superstition)
many things waiting to be done (idiom)/a thousand things to do
ills of the day/contemporary problems
bold and decisive
to transition to a new dynasty or regime
